title: Temporary Hit Points
excerpt: A buffer of extra hit points that absorb damage before your actual hit points. Temporary hit points don't stack and aren't restored by healing.
markdown:
# Temporary Hit Points

Some spells and special abilities confer temporary hit points to a creature. Temporary hit points aren't actual [[hit_points]]; they are a buffer against damage, a pool of hit points that protect you from injury.

## Rules

### Not Real Hit Points
- Temporary hit points are **separate** from your actual hit points
- When you take damage, temporary hit points are lost **first**
- Any leftover damage carries over to your normal hit points

### Don't Stack
- If you have temporary hit points and receive more, you **don't add them together**
- Instead, you decide whether to keep the temporary hit points you have or gain the new ones
- For example, if a spell grants you 12 temporary hit points when you already have 10, you can have 12 or 10, not 22

### Can't Be Healed
- You can't regain temporary hit points through healing
- Temporary hit points can't be added to your normal hit points
- If you have 0 hit points, receiving temporary hit points doesn't restore you to consciousness

### Duration
- Unless a feature that grants you temporary hit points has a duration, they last until they're depleted or you finish a [[long_rest]]

## Common Sources

- **Inspiring Leader** feat: Grant temporary HP to allies
- **False Life** spell: Grant yourself temporary HP
- **Heroism** spell: Grant temporary HP at the start of each turn
- **Armor of Agathys** spell: Gain temporary HP and deal cold damage to attackers
- **Fiendish Resilience** (Warlock): Gain resistance and temporary HP
- **Rage Beyond Death** (Barbarian): While raging at 0 HP, damage reduces temporary HP instead
